column6: Last #NICAR18 session = archiving data journalism. So important! I've lost so many old projects and it's so frustrating!

Dear #NICAR18 folks:Over the last few days, you learned how to make amazing data vizzes  and stories with code. Now, come learn how to ensure people can still see your work in 2-5 years. We talk data journalism preservation at 11:30. #savethebestforlast  http://bit.ly/2FIDkkM

csvmatch #NICAR18 session inspired me to finally install Python + packages. Process went flawlessly on my Windows PC. Somewhat, um, different experience with MacBook so far.  Off to set up virtual environments....

For those of you who came out to "Machine Learning for News Reporting" in @reesenewslab last month, here's a relevant tutorial from @forestgregg & @jean_cochrane at #NICAR18  https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TuAVqj2PQiLMg4t_8ByKLyUV1KLPZekWOgmTRQVlHBI/edit …

My grandfather grew up in Chicago. I’d never been here before now. Grateful that #NICAR18 gave me an excuse. Fitting that some of the research skills we talk about led me to two of the still-standing buildings where he lived. 1923 city directory, 1940 Census: thank you.  pic.twitter.com/MKHWSwiawj
Thinking my #NICAR19 lightning talk pitch should be about what a pain time zones, UTC and stupid Daylight Saving Time can be. #NiCAR18

Learned a lot, and got to meet some really great people at #nicar18. Especially enjoyed getting to hang with Star colleagues @LeahBecerra and @kelsey_ryan. I don't even mind that Kelsey totally stole my Trader Joe's candy bar.

This is the one that got me to write this thread. I appreciate this thread, but also think it is flawed. Of course “be flexible” is key... but when there are “so many jobs” at #NICAR18 yet women and people of color aren’t being hired, that points to another problem rather than blaming the diverse candidate applying.  https://twitter.com/twallack/status/972821117466501120 …

One thing I enjoy immensely at #nicar18 is hearing how journalists used techniques and data in new ways to tell a story. @mikejcorey explained how @reveal used satellite data to uncover excessive water use in a wealthy neighborhood: https://www.revealnews.org/article/who-is-the-wet-prince-of-bel-air-here-are-the-likely-culprits/ …

Huge shout out to those behind #NICAR18 ... took away so much to help my classes. Benefit vs cost ratio is off the charts. Can say that abt all of IRE and why I've been a member for so many yrs (and why my students must join -- it's their "textbook").

This #NICAR18 panel on building a data culture is basically a really constructive therapy session for us data reporters and editors. Everything from getting byline credit, to managing expectations, to making sure tools get used.

Not only should we think about how our coverage and our newsrooms are diverse/inclusive, we also need to look at our design. @angelicadesigns & @lenagroeger: Design for inclusiveness, be aware of under-represented communities, non-english speakers, people w/ impairments  #NICAR18

Levenshtein fuzzy matching detects how many letters are the same *and in the same position* between 2 character strings. Metaphone checks for strings that would be pronounced the same. Bilenko is based on machine learning. - @maxharlow at #NICAR18

#NICAR18: Heavy question, but what's your NICAR threat model? Mine is based around three assumptions: 1) physical surveillance (e.g. cameras) 2) infiltration by those opposed to the tenets of journalism, 3) insecure data networks.

Expectation in working with algorithms: What should be the behaviour? Where does the expectation comes from? How do we define that and measure it quantitatively? #nicar18 - thanks @ndiakopoulos for the great talk!

How to find an algorithm story - what should the algorithm's behavior be? How do you define that and measure it quantitatively? If reality differs from the expectation, that's a good place to start a story. #NICAR18
Three important questions to ask when you embark on a quick-turnaround data story #NICAR18:- What we know- What we have- What we need

If you make research on the deep web, *always* remember:1 - Use a separate device for research 2 - Do not show ties to your organization so use MiFi (personal wifi)3 - When possible keep research & production separate4 - Use encrypted USBs to securely store data#nicar18

Main take aways and bulletproofing tips from @sandhya__k & @TishaESPN - Don’t assume the data’s telling you the truth- Don’t get too excited if big numbers jump out at you from the data- Write down all the weird things about the data- Ask your colleagues their views #NICAR18

We are all librarians: Every time you find something valuable on the Web, everyone should save it IMMEDIATELY to the Wayback Machine  http://archive.org/web/ . Allows everyone to track even minute changes to Web content. Gary Price at #NICAR18

Don't judge a site by its title. The Disaster Information Management Research Center has an incredible set of public-health information updated regularly.  https://disasterlit.nlm.nih.gov/  Gary Price at #NICAR18

Before publication, send your work to a colleague with all the numbers pulled out and sourced. If you have another data journalist, ask them to replicate your numbers in a different programming language. Right from the stage of importing the data. #NICAR18

Beware rows of sums in Excel sheets! You can easily total a total. This falls under the "shortcuts will ruin your day" theme of this session. Know your dataset inside and out. #NICAR18
Weirdest/funniest tip I’ve learned so far at #nicar18: Photomath app lets you take photos of math problems (like algebra). It will solve them *and* show your work.
"Don't assume the data is telling you the truth. ... Data can lie to you." Words to live by. #NICAR18

Interrogate your data, especially missing/0/Null/NaN. Make sure the problem is really on the agency's end, not yours.  Re-import, re-import in a different way, then call the agency. #NICAR18
"Does your data smell right?" asks @sandhya__k - does something look off? Are there strange repetitions or very small or very large numbers that would not be expected? #NICAR18 #ddj
Bing's image search lets you highlight parts of an image for search purposes. InfoDocket's Gary Price at #NICAR18

No #NICAR18, dicas pra ter uma matéria guiada por dados "à prova de balas": 1. Documente suas dúvidas2. Faça uma cópia dos documentos originais antes de alterá-los3. Sobrestime o tempo pra verificar seu trabalho4. Consulte especialistas pra achar lacunas na sua análise #ddj

There's no such thing as a too-simple dataset. Treat a simple spreadsheet the same way you would a complex, multi-table database. Take your time, follow your protocol, show your work and at some point, retrace your steps. #NICAR18
Start a data log as soon as you do anything. It is labour intensive but it will save your sanity if you have to step away from the data and come back to it in a few weeks or months.  #NICAR18 #ddj
So nice to see again @TishaESPN and @sandhya__k here at #NICAR18: Bulletproofind data and the importance of keeping records of your work. This will really save you in certain situations #ddj #nicar18

First tips - save your raw data and do not touch that again (do all work in a copy). Also save a pdf of the original email from the person who sent it to you. Important for proof and paper trail. #NICAR18 #ddj
Think who might have the data: an organization, a government, a specific person. Don't start with Google. InfoDocket's Gary Price at #NICAR18
Super excited to learn #Python with @palewire #NICAR18 :)
Keep a data log: Plain English summary of what you actually did to a dataset. That keeps you organized and helps when you're writing up the "here's how I did this" piece. #NICAR18
Loving my first time at #NICAR18
Gary Price confirms one truth I learned in my years as a journalist: Librarians are the most valuable underappreciated professionals on the planet. #NICAR18
And keep a (virtual) paper trail, especially when dealing with FOIA etc. officers. Be able to show them what they said in the past. #NICAR18

Reason to make data reproducible from @DataMadeCo: It gives you the “freedom to forget” and still be able to do the analysis again alter. #NICAR18

DataMade calls it “Freedom to Forget” when your data analysis is reproducible and well-documented. When you come back to it later, you don’t need to remember all the details about how you did it. #NICAR18

Or, as you explore Chicago this weekend you can take time to learn a little more about the 77 Chicago Community Areas, 284 municipalities, and seven counties that make up this region through CMAP’s Community Data Snapshots.  https://datahub.cmap.illinois.gov/dataset/community-data-snapshots-raw-data … #NICAR18

Data from our most recent snapshot report on Natural Resources includes numbers on greenhouse gas emissions, temperature and precipitation changes, access to parks, water and air quality, and more.  https://datahub.cmap.illinois.gov/dataset/on-to-2050-snapshot-data-natural-resources/resource/6f4a7ae7-afe0-4c9c-9559-15bc28c0ee3c … #NICAR18

CMAP is developing the region’s next comprehensive plan, ON TO 2050. Data for the plan you can explore includes population and employment forecasts, transit trends, demographic shifts, our region’s freight system, and the regional economy. #NICAR18  https://datahub.cmap.illinois.gov/group/on-to-2050-report-data …

4 Things You Can Do To Save Data Journalism1. Take a video.2. Bake out. Make static versions of dynamic pages.3. Plan for the future. Make a sunset plan at the time of launch.4. Work with libraries, memory institutions, and commercial archives.#NICAR18

How to archive your work:1/ Take a video of your project.2/ Make static versions of dynamic pages.3/ Make a sunset plan at launch time.4/ Work with libraries/archives.No one will dig through your personal hard drive in 50 years. #NICAR18
This IS a dark panel. “Death comes to all of us,” reminds @merbroussard #NICAR18

Four things everyone can do to save data journalism #DDJ, from @merbroussard: Take a video (good for multiple platforms - can do a walkthru of your app for instance) Make static versions of dynamic pages (bake them out)#NICAR18
A box of drives or documents in your closet isn't going to be accessible to future historians, says @merbroussard. Get that gold to a library or other official digital archive! #NICAR18

My last session at #nicar18: How to avoid Rookie mistakes. First question to ask your data is „what’s wrong with you?“. Check for entry errors, outliers, duplicated infos, shift in standards, blanks and zeros, look for other data sources and cross-check.  pic.twitter.com/7hSQ1UaFIH
My last session in #NICAR18: Logistic regression in R. Bold.
Instead of flattening interactives into static archives for permanence, @katy_boss says that emulation may be the future. ReproZip is that attempt (but not yet ready for news apps.) #NICAR18
For reproducing and emulating projects, @katy_boss recommends trying ReproZip #NICAR18  pic.twitter.com/Pxzp0lI4So
#NICAR18, how are you over already?? Thank you @IRE_NICAR for bringing us all together every year, and esp. this year in Chicago

Archiving Commandments from @palewire1) archive your own work2) publish as static files eventually3) don't depend on rando dependent links4) version your css & templates5) use internet archive, etc as a platform (use API)#NICAR18
Excellent tip from @palewire: contribute your news to the Internet Archive  https://archive.org/about/  #NICAR18
@palewire  Thou shalt version your css and base templates Thou shalt treat big archives as a platform#NICAR18

Everyone in the archiving session today: I accosted an @internetarchive employee just yesterday professing my love for the project and my intense desire to work on curation. And he was stoked to hear it! They want journos involved! #NICAR18

Ben (@palewire) on his 'commandments' for archiving content: Thou shalt not make a mess and expect someone to clean it up for you Thou shalt publish as static files, immediately or eventually Thou shalt not depend on rando links#NICAR18

This #NICAR18 panel on building a data culture is basically a really constructive therapy session for us data reporters and editors. Everything from getting byline credit, to managing expectations, to making sure tools get used.

Not only should we think about how our coverage and our newsrooms are diverse/inclusive, we also need to look at our design. @angelicadesigns & @lenagroeger: Design for inclusiveness, be aware of under-represented communities, non-english speakers, people w/ impairments  #NICAR18

Levenshtein fuzzy matching detects how many letters are the same *and in the same position* between 2 character strings. Metaphone checks for strings that would be pronounced the same. Bilenko is based on machine learning. - @maxharlow at #NICAR18

#NICAR18: Heavy question, but what's your NICAR threat model? Mine is based around three assumptions: 1) physical surveillance (e.g. cameras) 2) infiltration by those opposed to the tenets of journalism, 3) insecure data networks.

Expectation in working with algorithms: What should be the behaviour? Where does the expectation comes from? How do we define that and measure it quantitatively? #nicar18 - thanks @ndiakopoulos for the great talk!

How to find an algorithm story - what should the algorithm's behavior be? How do you define that and measure it quantitatively? If reality differs from the expectation, that's a good place to start a story. #NICAR18
Three important questions to ask when you embark on a quick-turnaround data story #NICAR18:- What we know- What we have- What we need

Takeaway #2 from #NICAR18:Libraries, tools, plug-ins, widgets, and what-nots come out at a faster rate than our ability to learn them all. We can (and should) focus on the tools we think will help us, and not feel beholden to learn all the tools.#partylikeajournalist

If you make research on the deep web, *always* remember:1 - Use a separate device for research 2 - Do not show ties to your organization so use MiFi (personal wifi)3 - When possible keep research & production separate4 - Use encrypted USBs to securely store data#nicar18

Como encontrar lides e fatos publicáveis em massas de texto (ex: discursos públicos)? Eis o fluxo de trabalho: 1. Obtenha o texto 2. Divida-o em pedaços q o computador possa entender 3. Analise o texto mesclando técnicas (dicas no próximo tweet) 4.Verifique seu trabalho #NICAR18

Going to the data source and showing them what you have done helps bulletproofing. It's the data equivalent of saying "here's what we are going to publish about you, do you have any comment". #NICAR18 #ddj
If you are going to do something super-complex, find a guide who can guide you through the process and have an ongoing conversation about the data analysis you're going to be doing #NICAR18

Hey, #NICAR18, come on over to Advanced SQL at 10:15 in Perdue/Wisconsin. We may have the Excedrin for your data headache!

Main take aways and bulletproofing tips from @sandhya__k & @TishaESPN - Don’t assume the data’s telling you the truth- Don’t get too excited if big numbers jump out at you from the data- Write down all the weird things about the data- Ask your colleagues their views #NICAR18

We are all librarians: Every time you find something valuable on the Web, everyone should save it IMMEDIATELY to the Wayback Machine  http://archive.org/web/ . Allows everyone to track even minute changes to Web content. Gary Price at #NICAR18

Hi #NICAR18, if you are in the class about discovering stories through visualization, here are the few slides I used in the opening:  https://www.dropbox.com/s/yenwn3diny86gl8/Nicar2018Exploration.pdf?dl=0 … pic.twitter.com/KjrXD3lYPL

Librarians rule  (at @infodocket 's Gary Price talk about digging through the web) #NICAR18

Worried about your Web research disappearing? Use Webrecorder to save your HTML pages as you browse.  https://webrecorder.io/  Gary Price at #NICAR18

Do your analysis, then say to a colleague "Here's my dataset, here's what I asked. What would YOU ask of this data?" Then ask your mom the same. #NICAR18

Before publication, send your work to a colleague with all the numbers pulled out and sourced. If you have another data journalist, ask them to replicate your numbers in a different programming language. Right from the stage of importing the data. #NICAR18

Interrogate your data, especially missing/0/Null/NaN. Make sure the problem is really on the agency's end, not yours.  Re-import, re-import in a different way, then call the agency. #NICAR18
"Does your data smell right?" asks @sandhya__k - does something look off? Are there strange repetitions or very small or very large numbers that would not be expected? #NICAR18 #ddj
Bing's image search lets you highlight parts of an image for search purposes. InfoDocket's Gary Price at #NICAR18

There's no such thing as a too-simple dataset. Treat a simple spreadsheet the same way you would a complex, multi-table database. Take your time, follow your protocol, show your work and at some point, retrace your steps. #NICAR18
Start a data log as soon as you do anything. It is labour intensive but it will save your sanity if you have to step away from the data and come back to it in a few weeks or months.  #NICAR18 #ddj
So nice to see again @TishaESPN and @sandhya__k here at #NICAR18: Bulletproofind data and the importance of keeping records of your work. This will really save you in certain situations #ddj #nicar18

First tips - save your raw data and do not touch that again (do all work in a copy). Also save a pdf of the original email from the person who sent it to you. Important for proof and paper trail. #NICAR18 #ddj
Think who might have the data: an organization, a government, a specific person. Don't start with Google. InfoDocket's Gary Price at #NICAR18
Super excited to learn #Python with @palewire #NICAR18 :)
Keep a data log: Plain English summary of what you actually did to a dataset. That keeps you organized and helps when you're writing up the "here's how I did this" piece. #NICAR18
Loving my first time at #NICAR18
Gary Price confirms one truth I learned in my years as a journalist: Librarians are the most valuable underappreciated professionals on the planet. #NICAR18
And keep a (virtual) paper trail, especially when dealing with FOIA etc. officers. Be able to show them what they said in the past. #NICAR18

Primeira sessão do dia: como tornar sua análise de dados reprodutível? Algumas dicas: 1. Dataset original é lava: não toque! 2. Crie um processo padronizado 3. uma mudança na base = uma linha de código no script ou de texto na documentação #nicar18

Reason to make data reproducible from @DataMadeCo: It gives you the “freedom to forget” and still be able to do the analysis again alter. #NICAR18

DataMade calls it “Freedom to Forget” when your data analysis is reproducible and well-documented. When you come back to it later, you don’t need to remember all the details about how you did it. #NICAR18

Or, as you explore Chicago this weekend you can take time to learn a little more about the 77 Chicago Community Areas, 284 municipalities, and seven counties that make up this region through CMAP’s Community Data Snapshots.  https://datahub.cmap.illinois.gov/dataset/community-data-snapshots-raw-data … #NICAR18

Data from our most recent snapshot report on Natural Resources includes numbers on greenhouse gas emissions, temperature and precipitation changes, access to parks, water and air quality, and more.  https://datahub.cmap.illinois.gov/dataset/on-to-2050-snapshot-data-natural-resources/resource/6f4a7ae7-afe0-4c9c-9559-15bc28c0ee3c … #NICAR18

CMAP is developing the region’s next comprehensive plan, ON TO 2050. Data for the plan you can explore includes population and employment forecasts, transit trends, demographic shifts, our region’s freight system, and the regional economy. #NICAR18  https://datahub.cmap.illinois.gov/group/on-to-2050-report-data …

First Place = Dangerous Doses  by @chicagotribune. Reporters have discovered that more than half of the 255 pharmacies they tested failed to warn patients about potentially deadly interactions   http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/watchdog/druginteractions/ … #ddj #nicar18

Second Place = Too Broke for Bankruptcy  by @ProPublica. A project bankruptcy data that discovers how black Americans  are far less likely to gain relief from creditors than their white peers  https://www.propublica.org/series/too-broke-for-bankruptcy … #ddj #nicar18

Third Place = No Place For Foreigners  by @SPIEGELONLINE. Reporters set out to find if structural discrimination against foreigners in the German  housing market existed. They found out Arab and Turkish names were frequently ignored  https://www.hanna-und-ismail.de/english/index.html … #ddj #nicar18

The 2017 Philip Meyer Awards winners have been announced by @IRE_NICAR! Congratulations to the great work of @chicagotribune, @ProPublica, @BR_Presse, @SPIEGELONLINE. Links to the work to follow -> #ddj #nicar18 [thread]
